Do you know if there's a way to create a BP as a vendor without having the FLVN00 FLVN01 roles? thank you.

entry.title: Re: Waitlisted users (order and duplication)
entry.content: Hi @Hermann_Britto15 thank you for your question. I have investigated once more but unfortunately there is no change of behavior since my last post. I have found an improvement request which is currently "Under Review" and supported from over 45 companies. I couldn't find any specific enhancements on the road map for this issue at this point. I would suggest following and voting for the improvement request - https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/241863/?section=sectionDetails

entry.title: Your Step-by-Step Guide to SAP Sales Cloud V2 Certification
entry.content:
The SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP Sales Cloud Version 2   exam is designed for professionals who want to demonstrate their ability to configure, implement, and use the  new SAP Sales Cloud solution. With organizations increasingly relying on cloud-based sales tools, this credential sets you apart as someone who can deliver value through modern, intelligent sales processes.

If you’re planning to pursue this certification, here’s a structured roadmap using the official resources available.

Step 1: Start with the Learning Journey

Your first stop should be the Learning Journey: Implementing SAP Sales Cloud V2. This guided path introduces you to the fundamentals and provides structured exercises to practice key business user and configuration skills.

The Learning Journey covers the essentials:

  • Daily workflows for sales representatives and managers
  • Core capabilities and navigation of Sales Cloud V2
  • Machine learning fundamentals and generative AI overview
  • Integration with Microsoft Teams and mobile app functionality

By following it through, you’ll gain both conceptual understanding and practical hands-on experience.

Step 2: Join the “Get Certified” Live Session Series

Next, enroll in the “Get Certified: SAP Certified Associate – Implementation Consultant – SAP Sales Cloud V2” live session series. These structured, expert-led sessions are designed to complement your independent study with:

  • A Kickoff session (1 hour), which walks through exam format, question types, preparation strategies, and sample questions

  • A series of five additional 1-hour sessions, each focusing on key Learning Journey units

By participating, you gain direct guidance from certified trainers, reinforce your understanding of the most exam-relevant content, and practice with realistic sample questions—all of which are invaluable for aligning study with exam demands.

Step 3: Optional Microlearning Videos for Just-in-Time Insights

If you’d like to reinforce particular areas or learn on the go, consider exploring the bite-sized microlearning videos  in the Sales Cloud V2 category. These videos are concise, accessible, and perfect for filling knowledge gaps just when you need it.

Step 4: Hands-on Practical Test (Required to Unlock Exam Booking)

Before you can book the certification exam, SAP requires proof of hands-on competence. This is fulfilled by the “Demonstrating the Value of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2” practical test within your Learning Journey. 

If you have gone through the Learning Journey exercises, this step should be straightforward. The tasks in the test are based on what you’ve already practiced, making it a natural extension of your preparation. Once passed, the “Schedule Exam” button becomes available, allowing you to book your certification exam. 

Step 5: Prepare for the Certification Exam

Next, focus your preparation on the exam content itself:

  • Implementation basics and clean-core principles
  • Master data management (accounts, contacts, products, pricing)
  • Sales processes including leads, opportunities, contracts, quotations, and orders
  • User management, personalization, and security
  • Use this framework to guide your revision and ensure full coverage.

Step 5: Practice and Review

After completing the learning resources, reinforce your knowledge through practice:

  • Revisit exercises in the Learning Journey

  • Test yourself with sample exam questions, if available

Consistent review will help you move from memorization to confident application of concepts.

Final Thoughts

The path to SAP Sales Cloud V2 certification is clear when you use the right resources. Start with the Learning Journey, take advantage of quarterly expert sessions and study according to the exam guide. By combining structured learning with consistent practice, you’ll be ready to validate your expertise and move forward as a trusted SAP Sales Cloud consultant.

But when I tried to Access the System, it's not open the System. it's stuck at the page given below mentioning Please wait, session is preparing.. entry.title: Should SDF for Singapore recalculate in retroactive accounting in the prior period?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I'm looking for some guidance on the rules around whether the SDF contribution for Singapore payroll should be recalculated for a retro period. 

Example - Retroactive onboard IN period 4 FOR period 3.

Employee start date 25.03 so part month calculated in period 4 for period 3. No SDF is being calculated for period 3, the retro gross is being carried forward into the current period (period 4) and being used to calculate the SDF contribution for period 4. 

Is this correct functionality? Is there anything we should be doing to calculate a contribution for period 3? We are experiencing under contributions after year end from the board with regards to the SDF contributions and are trying to understand where these are coming from.

entry.title: Re: Commission Contract: Copy Control for Conditions
entry.content: Thank you Michael. I will investigate the use of RCS6 and compare to the RCS1+RCA1 combination. In the meantime, are you able to repost the link to the configuration document please? It does not seem to work for me and I think it would be very beneficial for me to see that. Additionally, I wanted to share that we have another requirement to manage accruals on Billing Docs but Commissions should be on Billing Docs Paid. These are two mutually exclusive contract types. Essentially I want to use a different business volume table per Settlement Type and not per Contract Type. I am open to suggestions on how best to approach this, assuming it will be implemented as a custom solution.

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508: Custom tile for Custom UI5 application with parameters
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I have an issue with the Fiori app Display Line Item Entry (F2218) , which does not accept the URL parameters "P_FromPostingDate" and "P_ToPostingDate".

In on-premise systems I was able to solve this by creating a new tile as a copy of the standard one and adding the required parameters.

The problem is that in S/4HANA Public Cloud there is no SAP Fiori Launchpad Designer, so I cannot create a new tile in this way.

I used the following reference to create a Custom Tile, but this only works for external applications and does not allow me to add new parameters.

¿How can I create a tile with parameters in S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508?

Thank you very much.

Best regards,

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Session | APAC | English
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Have you recently requested provisioning of SAP Cloud ALM? We are thrilled to welcome you aboard! Your journey with #SAP Cloud ALM is about to begin, and we’re here to ensure it is smooth and efficient.

To assist you in this journey, we would like to invite you to one of the below online webinars where we’ll guide you through the setup process and answer any questions you may have.

What to Expect in the Webinar

The SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Webinar has been designed to ensure that you and your team are set up for success. During the session, we will:

  • Demonstrate the initial login procedures to access your SAP Cloud ALM tenant.
  • Provide guidance on the next steps to use the solution effectively.
  • Highlight essential training resources to support you and your team’s learning journey.
  • Answer any questions you may have during the session.

Your Next Steps

To make the most of your SAP Cloud ALM onboarding experience, here’s what you need to do:

  1. Share this information with your key stakeholders.

    • Ensure that IT Admins, Project Leads, and Implementation or Operations Partners responsible for SAP Cloud ALM are informed.
    • Don’t forget to forward the webinar invitation to your project implementation partner for their participation.

  2. Register for the Webinar.
    Register Now

We’re excited to embark on this journey with you! Let’s make the most of SAP Cloud ALM together. See you at the webinar!

entry.title: Re: Bringing Back Badges to Reward Q&A Experts!

In the near future, we plan to introduce other progression sets. We don’t want to give away too much information just yet – we thought it would be fun to keep things a surprise – but we do encourage you to get more active, as you may find yourself receiving bigger badge payoffs very soon."

ZFiori.

entry.title: System default Main budget clarification in SAP B1 [1st time upload Budget SAPVer10 Fp2111]
entry.content:
Hi SAP B1 Team,

Can I use the system locked and default "Main budget [Grey Condition]" budget scenario and upload the budgets as per below screen shots.  Is it cause any issue in the reporting and future transaction issues?

Note:

1.  This is our new SAP B1 system ver 10 FP2111 and start to setup budget scenario,  When we start budget scenario system automatically created 1st row as "Main Budget [Grey Condition] with locked condition [I checekd backend and shown as locked in the main budget].  In this case can I use this Main budget scenario to upload the budgets like the below screenshots? Pls check and let me know your valuable feedback for this.   
2.  For your info., System allows to upload the budget details without any issue by DTW process [Grey and Locked Main budget (System default)

Thanks & Regards,

Mohan Sivakumar

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALMを申請したお客様向けウェルカムセッションのご案内 (日本語開催)
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALMを申請したお客様向けウェルカムセッションのご案内 (日本語開催)

このセッションでは、SAP Cloud ALMのコンセプトや機能概要と合わせ、SAP Cloud ALM プロビジョニング後に必要となるSAP Cloud ALMの初回アクセス方法や必要となる初期設定方法についても説明いたします。
SAP Cloud ALMの概要をまず押さえたい方やSAP Cloud ALMのプロビジョニングが完了したものの、その後の利用準備に至っていない方など、SAP Cloud ALMの活用に向けてスタートしたいお客様、パートナー様にとって最適なセッションです。

 

アジェンダ：

·         SAP Cloud ALMへの初回アクセス方法

·         ユーザの追加と初期設定の方法

·         機能概要のご紹介

·         役立つ資料やサイトのご案内

·         Q&A

Register Now

entry.title: Managing Additional Items in Sourcing Event for the Requisitions integrated via SNAP Buying
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have a requirement from the customer where they are using SNAP Buying PR > Sourcing Request > Sourcing Project > PR Approval > PO Creation Process.

Process of Business:

  • The user creates the PR with Required Items and clicks on "Create Sourcing Request" to proceed with the Sourcing
  • During Sourcing Event suppliers can propose the additional items that might be required for the purchase.
  • Buyer will award suppliers with PR based items and supplier included items.
  • The items needs to be included in PR if awarded.

We tested but the system is not capturing the additional items, need some views on how the scenario can be handeled.

entry.title: Re: Ideas of ATP-PAC enh: changing ATP parameter during A...
entry.content:
Hi @FabianHornung  One of the reason is the loss of the APO-RBA functionality, i.e. 'Activity' as part of the Rule>Procedure>Substitution List.

A few generic requirements:

  • Switching to MTO process
  • Switching Scope of check (ex: Differentiated process from main plant to subs plant)
  • Turn off PAC or PAL or both
  • unconfirm certain orders through rules/conditions

entry.title: Re: Ideas of ATP-PAC enh: changing ATP parameter during A...
entry.content: Adding details, these 4 are no longer in S/4 aATP.

entry.title: ✨ Dubai SAP Community – Let’s Connect! ✨
entry.content:
In our last connect during the Code Jam event, we were all deeply focused on learning and exploring technology together. This time, I was thinking it would be wonderful if we could shift the focus a little—towards connecting with each other on a personal level, getting to know one another better, and exploring how we can support each other and our customers even more.

I’d like to propose a get-together on 26th September (evening) in Dubai. The idea is to keep it simple and informal—whether in an office space or a casual spot—just a chance to meet, share, and strengthen our community bonds.

It would be great if you could share in the comments:
✅ If you’d like to join
✅ Any suggestions for the venue in Dubai

Looking forward to your thoughts, and I really hope many of us can make it—it’ll be great to see familiar faces again and welcome new ones too. 🌟

entry.title: Re: Services for object ME23N
entry.content:
The screen shot error message is self explanatory. Did you check with your Security team?

Ask the user to note the file path mentioned in the prompt. Ensure they have read/write access to that location. If the path is a network drive or restricted folder, consider changing the default attachment path in SAP GUI settings

Also, if this issue only affects one user, compare their SAP GUI settings and Windows permissions with a working user. Often, the difference lies in local configuration, not SAP system settings.

entry.title: ABAP Platform 2023, Developer Edition on Cloud Appliance Library (CAL): NOW SMALLER!
entry.content:
Dear all, 

For those of you who *don't* want to download the Docker version of ABAP Cloud Developer Trial, we also provide a hosted appliance template, SAP ABAP Platform, Developer Edition, on SAP Cloud Appliance Library (CAL). The ABAP Platform part of this is free, but you still have to pay for the IaaS resources (AWS / ARM / GCP). As some of you have pointed out, the resources allocated are relatively large: 256 GB RAM, 32 cores.

You're right of course. So we're now offering a much smaller version: 64 GB RAM, 10 cores.

H/T to @TMNielsen for pointing this out and testing it 😎.

And of course to all the colleagues who helped make this happen. 

Enjoy!

SAP ABAP Platform Trial 2023 on SAP Cloud Appliance Library (CAL)

entry.title: Re: Can we discuss SAP ABAP Platform 2022 SP01, Developer...

Hi Thomas, @TMNielsen ,

Bet you thought we'd forgotten you :-|.

Finally, here it is: 64 GB memory, 8 cores:

SAP ABAP Platform 2023 developer edition on SAP HANA (CAL) .

Thanks for both pointing this out and testing.

Best wishes,

Julie Plummer

ABAP PM.

entry.title: Exploring the Future of Business with AI at SAP NOW Argentina
entry.content:
Next week, on August 28th, an inspiring and game-changing event will be taking place in Argentina. In Buenos Aires, SAP arrives in this South American country with its NOW AI Tour and we will be attending. It will be a one-day event and it will focus on how to enhance our enterprise’s outcomes, operations, growth, and overall future with Artificial Intelligence. But it’s not only an event shaped towards the goal of learning, but also aiming to provide a time to share with colleagues from different departments! This is because the event is designed for everyone who is involved in technology transformation, like IT, HR, operations, finance, and many more. 

What to Expect

The full schedule is yet to be finalized, but we already have some details on what the event will consist of. It will start with a morning kick-off, providing useful information on SAP’s strategy and vision regarding AI, application, and data. This will be followed by a full day of sessions with promising speakers sharing the latest enterprise management solutions and their personal experiences with AI, along with real innovation stories. Basically, a priceless day of innovation that you should save the date for.

Now, besides the agenda and the experiences planned for the day— which already are solid reasons to attend SAP NOW AI Tour in Argentina — there are a couple of other things to bear in mind and that make this event stand out even more:

  • Networking opportunities: As I stated earlier, the event is not meant to be for a restricted group of people. You will have the opportunity — and the space — to share and engage with peers that maybe, in another context or situation, you wouldn’t even think of approaching. It’s the perfect setting for collaboration and fresh ideas.
  • Keeping up with AI trends: Though the focus will probably be on how to implement AI now it’s never amiss to discuss what may wait for us in the future. There won’t be a better place for this other than SAP AI NOW Tour to explore as a community the trends that are emerging regarding Artificial Intelligence and to understand both where technology in general is heading and how to be prepared for this.
  • Impulse new conversations with clients: The event will provide concrete examples and ideas to help open the door to transformational projects, from process automation to AI-driven operations.

My Take as  a Brand Leader

For me, events like this are about two things: getting inspired and getting practical. On the one hand, I want to hear how global leaders see the future of business with AI. On the other, I’m looking for concrete ideas we can bring back to our teams and clients. I will be looking out for things we can start testing or integrating into our own digital engineering projects.

Final Thoughts 

In conclusion, it’s a day worth marking on the calendar: one packed with insights, connections, and inspiration to keep moving our projects forward. A fabulous space for engaging in ethical AI conversations and celebrating the innovative approaches being implemented in different parts of the world!

entry.title: CPI DS: Job logs extracting for IBP loads through Flat Files by using batch commands
entry.content:
Step 1:

Create a Planning level structure for target file format based on Attributes, KF ID, Date and additional fields which is highlighted.

Step 2:

Create a task

 Source                                                                                       

Target

Step 3:

 Use IBP Replication table to bring the required fields

Step 4:

In Transform1 - Map required fields with attributes to output and apply filter for batch ID and pass as Global variable

Step 5:

 Note: Maintain structure in data store and place file in same server path which we created Planning level structure created for Target.

file as attached: FF_IBP_REJECTIONDESCR.txt (convert to .csv)

In Transform 2 : Apply lookup based on error message (MSGV1) from this file using MSGID and map to error message in file

lookup(FF_IB_LOGS.FF_IBP_REJECTIONDESCR."FF_IBP_REJECTIONDESCR.csv",MSG,'N/A','PRE_LOAD_CACHE',MSGID,Transform1.MSGID)

For reference below are the fields I pulled into next level to get the results.

Step 6:

Target query map with end-to-end fields with straight mapping and below are the main fields which need to be mapped.

Step 7:

Maintain GV for output file if needed

Maintain structure for result:

Run the job:

Here, which you ran recently that can be seen in IBP Data integration, get the batch_id from there and note the number of count records.

CPI-DS Monitor log

Finally, the Log has been extracted to File and can compare those records and rejection details from the agent server.

Regards,MK

entry.title: SAP INSIDE TRACK Kolkata 2025: A Vibe, A Vision, A Voyage!
entry.content:
🖥️ Code 🤝 Community ✨ Collaboration

I had the absolute honor of volunteering with the help of @DataTherapist  at one of the most dynamic SAP community events of the year, SIT KOLKATA 2025 — and wow, what an experience! 💥

Being part of the engine that powered this event gave me a front-row seat to the magic of collaboration and innovation.

💬 Keynote - To Boost the Journey

@josh_bentley , Srini reddy Gottimukkula, Pankaj Lal and Revarand Dr. John Felix Raj keynote gave a boost start of the event.

🎤 Sessions that challenged perspectives

Panel Discussion driven by Monimoy Kundu with Sharmistha Sanyal, Pankaj Lal, Prasun Dutta, Debashis Majumder and Tilak Kumar. Another panel discussion driven by Amitava Nag with Prof. Amlan Chakrabarti, Dr. Indranil Mitra, Dr. Saptarsi Goswami, Mr. Sabyasachi Biswas, Mr. Manoj Mishra and Srini reddy Gottimukkula.

Supply Chain Transformation through AI by Jayabharathy Jothiprakasam, Warehouse Operation by Next-Gen AI Mobile Application by Avik Poddar.

Moving forward a great Cloud ALM Roadshow, driven by Sunil Chopra. Afterwards an excellent session on SAP Business Data Cloud by Srini reddy Gottimukkula and Jitendra Ghanta.

🤝 People who inspired me beyond words

Awesome Joule demonstration by Kousik Goon gave us a lot of insights, then Business AI with S/4 Hana delivered by Sangeeta Majumdar and GenAI Assets and Process of IBM by Aditi Chatterjee and Avijit Dhar. Moving forward great session by Arit Basu on Invoicing using SAP Business Network and SAP SAM 2505 session delivered by Abhishek Chatterjee had a powerful impact.

Then, Ritesh Agrawal delivered a session on embedding GenAI into Business Strategy, Sumanta Basu gave his insights on SAP conversational and GenAI - Bengali Chatbot, Partha Goswami conducted a session on how one can start their journey as an AI Engineer, Arghadip Kar delivered a impactful session on pre-requisities of S/4 Hana transformation, Foundation for GenAI with SAP - this great insights delivered by Vishwa Vivek Anand.

Later on, a session of SAP on AWS delivered by Amitava Nag, insights on data engineering with databricks given by Mohammad Afsar Imam, another session on Lakeflow Connect Overview delivered by Krishnendu Hazra and lastly insights on Retails Analytics on Databricks delivered by Pritam Paul.

A big thank you to the primary sponsor Westernacher Consulting and venue partner St. Xavier's University for the continuous support. Also, support by SAP PRESS, Linc Limited is commendable.

Also, thank you to all the speakers and tremendous efforts by other fellow volunteers for make this event such insightful and interesting.

Volunteering here wasn’t just about giving back — it was about growing forward. And I’m walking away with new skills, new friends, and a renewed sense of purpose.🌟

#SAPInsideTrack #SITKolkata2025 #SAPCommunity #VolunteeringWithPurpose #TechWithHeart #GratefulAndGrowing #BehindTheScenesMagic

entry.title: Re: RRB Billing by Activity Type (Consultant Roles) and Q...
entry.content:
Yes, DIP profile summarization by activity type is the correct approach to achieve billing by consultant role. In SAP, Activity Types are typically mapped to roles like Senior Consultant, Junior Consultant, etc. The DIP profile can be configured to summarize costs by activity type, allowing you to group billing items accordingly. This setup ensures that the billing document reflects role-based cost aggregation, rather than WBS element-based breakdown.
Use Transaction ODP1 to define your DIP profile. In the Characteristics section, enable summarization by:

  • Activity Type
  • Transaction Currency
  • Unit of Measure

In Material Determination, map each activity type to a corresponding sales material (e.g., “Senior Consultant Hours”).

Coming to output, yes you are right again. SD quotations typically show a single service line item, but your client wants a hierarchical breakdown of roles and hours under a package like “Cloud Implementation.”

  • What you can do is expand the DIP profile logic to include consultant roles and hours. Use a custom form to display this breakdown in the quotation output. This is the most flexible and widely used approach.
  • ECP allows you to plan services and costs in a structured way. You can define service packages and subcomponents (roles, hours). However, ECP is more suited for internal planning and cost estimation, not necessarily for SD quotation output unless tightly integrated.

If you're on S/4HANA, the Solution Quotation process allows bundling services and products. You can define a “Cloud Implementation” package and explode it into sub-items like consultant roles and hours. This supports automatic follow-up documents (e.g., service orders) and can be enhanced with output control

entry.title: Enabling Background Job Execution in S/4HANA from Fiori Using CDS and OData
entry.content:
Business Scenario

Imagine a purchasing department needing to update material prices based on market conditions. Instead of manually running a report in background mode, users can select materials in a Fiori app and click “Update Prices”, which triggers a background job with selected data. 

Component Purpose

CDS ViewFor showing material list in Fiori
OData Function ImportTriggers a background job
Fiori AppAllows selection + button click
ABAP ReportExecutes price update logic
SM37Monitor the job execution

Step-by-Step Implementation 

Step 1: CDS View for Material Selection 

This will expose a simple material list for selection.

Step 2: Create SEGW Project and Import CDS View 

  • T-code: SEGW 
  • Create project: Z_MATERIAL_JOB_API 
  • Import CDS view as Entity Type 
  • Generate runtime artifacts 

Step 3: Add Function Import to SEGW 

  1. In SEGW: 
  1. Right-click Data Model → Function Imports → Create

  2.  

     Name: TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB 
  3. Return Type: None 
  4. HTTP Method: POST 

2. In Modeling, assign an Entity Set if needed (optional). 

Step 4: Implement Function Import Logic 

In class: ZCL_Z_MATERIAL_JOB_API_DPC_EXT 

method /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action. 
 
  data: lv_jobname type tbtcjob value 'ZPRICE_UPDATE_JOB', 
        lv_jobcount type tbtco-jobcount, 
        lv_msg type string, 
        lt_materials type standard table of mara-matnr. 
 
  if iv_action_name = 'TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB'. 
 
    " (Optional) collect materials from CDS selection or payload 
    append 'MATERIAL1' to lt_materials. 
    append 'MATERIAL2' to lt_materials. 
 
    " Submit the job 
    call function 'JOB_OPEN' 
      exporting 
        jobname          = lv_jobname 
      importing 
        jobcount         = lv_jobcount 
      exceptions 
        others           = 1. 
 
    if sy-subrc = 0. 
      " Submit custom report in background 
      submit zmat_price_update_report 
        with so_matnr in lt_materials 
        user sy-uname 
        via job lv_jobname 
        number lv_jobcount 
        and return. 
 
      call function 'JOB_CLOSE' 
        exporting 
          jobname     = lv_jobname 
          jobcount    = lv_jobcount 
          strtimmed   = 'X' 
        exceptions 
          others      = 1. 
 
      lv_msg = |Job { lv_jobname } triggered successfully.|. 
 
    else. 
      lv_msg = 'Job could not be started.'. 
    endif. 
 
    " Send response back to OData 
    data: lr_return type ref to /iwbep/if_message_container. 
    lr_return = me->get_message_container( ). 
    lr_return->add_message( 
      exporting 
        iv_msg_text   = lv_msg 
        iv_msg_type   = /iwbep/if_message_container=>gcs_msg_type-success 
    ). 
 
  endif. 
 
endmethod.

Step 5: Background Report ZMAT_PRICE_UPDATE_REPORT

REPORT zmat_price_update_report. 
 
PARAMETERS: so_matnr TYPE mara-matnr RANGE. 
 
START-OF-SELECTION.	 
 
  LOOP AT so_matnr INTO DATA(lr). 
    " Dummy logic - Simulate price update 
    WRITE: / 'Updating price for material:', lr-low. 
  ENDLOOP.

Output – What Happens in Fiori

  1. User opens the Fiori app showing materials from CDS.

  2. Selects a few materials → clicks “Update Prices”.

  3. The TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB function import is called.

  4. SAP triggers a job: ZPRICE_UPDATE_JOB

  5. The custom report runs in background → check SM37

Log: 

Conclusion:

This approach bridges Modern UI and robust backend logic. You can now let Fiori apps initiate background-heavy tasks — like price updates, data migration, or batch jobs — with traceable and efficient execution.

entry.title: Re: Position of SAC input control check box
entry.content:
Hi,

Not possible with any standard functionality in SAC. It would be possible through the use of a custom widget to inject some custom css. The following example in the below screenshot has two checkbox widgets. The one on the left has a class added to the widget which is targeted by the custom css. The one on the right is identical but without the class.

The custom css injected is as follows:

.sap-user-defined-customBox label.sapFpaAppBuildingUiCheckboxWrapper {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row-reverse;
}

This leverages css flex to reverse the display order of the elements inside each row of the checkbox group.

For the custom css widget, please see: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/is-there-a-way-to-maintain-or-upload-custom-css-files-in-sap-analytics/qaa-p/14044971/highlight/true#M4907197

Cheers, Ivan.

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Creating a Formula Expression in BRF+
entry.content:
Business Scenario
We want to determine the Pension Bonus Amount based on:
Employee Service Years
Pension Bonus Base Amount
The formula might look like:
Pension Bonus Amount = Pension Bonus Base Amount x Service Years

Step-by-Step: Creating the Formula Expression in BRF+
Step 1: Create a Formula Expression
Navigate to your BRF+ Application.
Click on Create -> Expression -> Formula.

Enter a name for the formula, e.g., Formula_1, and click Create.

 

Formula Expression is created here we can create formula by two modes Normal mode and Expert mode

 

Normal Mode and Expert Mode
Normal Mode
User-Friendly Interface: Designed for users who prefer a simplified, guided way of creating formulas.
Predefined Options: You select from predefined functions, operators, and variables.
Limited Flexibility: Less control over complex logic; suitable for straightforward formulas.
Use Case: Ideal for users who want to quickly create formulas without delving into intricate details or custom logic.
Expert Mode
Advanced Features: Offers a more powerful and flexible environment.
Direct Formula Editing: You can directly write and edit the formula expressions, often in a text-based way.
Greater Control: Supports complex logic, nested functions, and custom expressions.
Customization: Allows more detailed and precise formula definitions.
Use Case: Suitable for advanced users or scenarios requiring complex logic that cannot be easily achieved in normal mode.


Step 2: Define Data Elements (Mass Creation)
We need to define three key data elements:
Pension Bonus Amount (Result)
Pension Bonus Base Amount
Service Years
To create these:
Go to Application -> Create -> Data Object -> Element (Mass Creation).
Define each required element with the appropriate data type (e.g., Amount, Integer, etc.).

 

Add resultant data object

click on result data object click on `Search'
Select required field

 

Step 3: Build the Formula
Place your cursor after the | next to the Result Data Object.
Click on Insert Data Object and select:
Pension Bonus Base Amount and Service Years

 

Step 4: Test the Expression (Simulation)
Click Start Simulation.
Enter test values for:
Pension Bonus Base Amount (e.g., 300)
Service Years (e.g., 10)
Click Execute.   

You should see the calculated Pension Bonus Amount
We get the output

 

 

Conclusion
Formula Expressions in BRF+ are a powerful tool for creating dynamic business rules and performing calculations using business context data. With both Normal and Expert modes available, users at any skill level can build and manage rules effectively—often without needing to write custom ABAP code.

In our example, we used a Formula Expression to calculate the Pension Bonus Amount based on an employee’s years of service and a base bonus value—something commonly needed in HR and payroll systems.

entry.title: Re: Transformation to ONB 2.0
entry.content:
Hi Shaurya,

This process is fairly simple. When ONB2.0 is enabled, the system will prefer initiation into ONB2.0. Unless you specify different criteria under Onboarding Integration Settings, all Initiate Onboarding actions will flow to ONB2.0.

Hope this clarifies.

Regards

Frans

entry.title: Re: After typing Supplier RMA number this is not displaye...
entry.content:
I am not clear with your statement "I checked the solution however the issue remains". Does it mean, you carried out the code correction as recommended in the SAP note but still the issue not resolved?. If so, you can raise a ticket to SAP citing this. Moreover, when I gone through this SAP note, there is no mention about this RMA copying functionality. So I doubt, whether it will address your requirement.

Moreover, as per SAP's explanation shown below,

the Order Acknowledgement field is just to maintain some value manually. If you want to automate, only via custom validation, it is possible. Before upgrade, if it was working,check any custom logic in BAdIs like ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST or ME_PROCESS_PO_HEADER

entry.title: Google Play requires that apps target API level 35 or higher
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently received a notification from Google Play stating that my app must target API level 35 or higher by August 31, 2025, to comply with their new requirements. Currently, my target SDK is set to API level 34.

Here is the message from Google Play 

*Google Play requires that apps target API level 35 or higher.

Update your target API level by August 31, 2025, to publish updates to your app. We have detected that your app targets an older version of Android. To provide users with a secure experience, Google Play requires all apps to meet the target API level requirements.

As of August 31, 2025, if your target API level is more than one year old compared to the latest Android release, you will not be able to update your app.*

Could someone guide me through the process of updating the target API level in SAP Build Apps? 

Thank you,

entry.title: CPI-DS: IBP Data Store Creation, Certifications upload and .pse file creation via linux
entry.content:
Step:1

Communication between CPI-DS and IBP

  1. Create the Communication User:
  • Create a new communication user. Provide some logical name as this will be the user for setting up the WebSocket RFC connection in CI-DS.
  • You can enter the password or select the Proposed password. If you use Proposed password, then you need to make a note of this. 
  1. Create the Communication System: 
  • Create a new communication system for WebSocket RFC

  • Select the Inbound Only 

  • Select the Users for Inbound Communication and add the communication user.

  3. Communication Arrangement:

  • Create the communication arrangement and select scenario SAP_COM_0593, and provide an arrangement name.

  • You need to add the communication system created in the step 2. The user is automatically populated as it was configured in the selected communication system. 

Step 2:

Data Services Agent Machine

  1.  Download and place the IBP Server Certificate in the SAP Data Service Agent Machine. 

The first step would be download the Current and New Root Certificate for IBP. You should download both the root CA certificate "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2" https://www.digicert.com/kb/digicert-root-certificates.htm#roots

    • Download the Root Certificate of DigiCert Global Root Serial #: 08:3B:E0:56:90:42:46:B1:A1:75:6A:C9:59:91:C7:4A 
    • Download the Root Certificate of DigiCert Global Root G2 with Serial #: 03:3A:F1:E6:A7:11:A9:A0:BB:28:64:B1:1D:09:FA:E5
  • Move or download these certificates in the SAP Data Services Agent machine. 
  1. Setting up the PSE File
  • Navigate to <agent_installation_folder>/bin and execute the command to generate the PSE File
    • Linux : ./sapgenpse.sh get_pse –p ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123!

Distinguished Name (DN): CN=IBPROCKS, O=SAP, C=US 

DN: The distinguished name. This must be unique per PSE file.
 
CN = <Common_Name> OU = <Organizational_Unit> O = <Organization> C = <Country>
For example, "CN=IBPROCKS, O=SAP, C=US"

  • Run sapgenpse seclogin. Here the <user_ID> has to be same as the logon user for DS agent service.
    • Linux: ./sapgenpse.sh seclogin -p ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123! -O \DS_USER

  • Add IBP Server Certificate to PSE File. You should add both certificates "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2" downloaded in the step 1.
  • You can execute the following command to add the Root Certificate in the PSE File. Please note that you need to execute the command twice to add both certificates. 
    • Linux:  ./sapgenpse.sh maintain_pk -a /home/ccloud/certificates/DigiCertGlobalRootG2.crt -p ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123!

  • You can execute the following command to list the added certificates in the PSE File. Both "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2"  should be shown as below:  
    • Linux: ./sapgenpse.sh maintain_pk -p ibp_no_password.pse -l -x WebSocket123!

Restart the SAP Data Services Agent. 

    • For Linux, you need to go to back to main directory
      • ./dsod_stop.sh (Stopping the agent)
      • ./dsod_start.sh (Starting the agent)  

Step 3:

Create the IBP Datastore in CPI-DS

Test the connection for IBP datastore:

Kindly Note: even though the test connection is successful for IBP Datastore. the Import options are not enabled for Master data, Transactional data & rest all folders. 

In addition, we tried with executing the connection in between FF to IBP or S4 to IBP tasks. and facing the error as below.

To fix the issue: Change the proxy connection in the IBP Datastore as given in below.

now, able to run the task with configuration as expected.

Regards,MK
